relation: Very expensive, but will hopefully be worth it in the long run. Hard to say because I am still studying and have no other college experience to compare it to
I enjoy being here very much, the environment is very good for learning, and San Diego is one of the most fun cities in the US!
Good professors who really know what they are teaching. The down fall is that all are more passionate teaching their upper division classes, which leaves required lower divisions dull and boring.
pageTitle: University of San Diego (USD) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex

textAfterTable: Beautiful campus, great professors, nice students, and wonderful campus environment san diego in general is beautiful always something to do near beaches, sea world, balboa park, downtown, etc Will learn a lot great academics small class sizes will work with me (20-30) professors care about their students Login to rate or flag the reviews Daniel from Littleton, CO 01/13/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 21 out of 21 people found this review useful. 2 of 86 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Surfer-dudes, likes to go the mall (Fashion and Mission Valley), student leaders, academically savvy students, confident and competent students. Tips for prospective students Get involved. The best way to be become a submersed college student is to meet as many people as you can, including professors. Get out of the dorm and feel the Sun--shorts and t-shirts in the Winter! As soon as you can find fun, your well on your way to a
